project.title: Dynamic Optimization Algorithm for Self-regulating Tokenomics
project.description:
Most tokenomics policies today (e.g. inflation rate, burning rate) are either coded statically or rely on DAO governance for adjustments. This approach ensures decentralization, but the lack of real-time response mechanisms also make the tokenomics vulnerable to the impact of external shocks, such as a large price movements and hacks.

How do we design tokenomics that is robust against these shocks, while preserving decentralization? The bold yet rational answer is: let a bot run the economy.

In this research project, my aim is to build an autonomous algorithm that regulates a blockchain economy with two key parameters: staking rate and burning rate. In particular, I apply a modeling tool from modern macroeconomic theory called DSGE, which is the gold standard used by central banks worldwide to determine key economic parameters like interest rates. Cutting-edge data science tools such as machine learning and causal inference models will be applied in the calibration process. This research will provide guidance for the new generation of protocol tokenomics.

**About the researcher**

My name is Ming and I am a graduate student and researcher at UChicago studying computational economics. I've worked as a research fellow at Nethermind and DeFi research analyst at Polygon. You can learn more about me and my previous work at https://sites.google.com/view/mingxuanhe

**Improvements on existing approaches**

The idea of optimizing burning and staking using dynamic modeling tools has seen growing exploration recently (e.g. @urosnoetic's post about BME in the previous round of TE grants, and multiple papers from the economics/finance literature in 2022/2023). My novelty is to develop a fully testable, calibratable model that also addresses uncertainty and lack of information. I also address key concerns such as algorithmic bias and systemic economic inequalities.

**Current state**

I have formalize the baseline model (Biais et al, 2020) in the context of tokenomics, and I'm currently in the phase of building the full model. [Presentation slides](https://github.com/mingxuan-he/dp-tokenomics/blob/master/Presentations/pitch_slides.pdf) can be found under the project github repo. The slides summarizes the current state of the research project, include a detailed introduction for the project, literature review, some technical components, and next steps.

**Expected outcome**

The expected result is a complete MA thesis paper (15-30 pages) which will go under the review of a graduate research committee at University of Chicago Kenneth C. Griffin Department of Economics. 
The end goal is to publish the paper in a peer-reviewed journal or conference. Before publication, I will open source the working paper and any relevant code on Github. The project is expected to take 4-5 months, with an upper limit of 8 months.

**Funding Usage**

As an international student in the US, it is extremely difficult to receive academic scholarships and research funding because of my foreign status. That's why I turned to this community of fellow builders for help. Funding from this grant would help me cover part of my advanced studies in computational economics as well as some paid research tools. Here's a plan on how the funding will be used on this project:
- Data: will try to use public data for initial stages, but later stages likely requires subscription-based APIs or databases (~$50/month * 5 months)
- Computational resources: I will need to use credit-based computing services such as AWS or the Midway Cluster for running large-scale computation and machine learning models. An example can be found at https://github.com/mingxuan-he/eth-fee-time-series (~$80/month * 5 months)
- Journal/conference submission & traveling expenses (~$1000)
- Total: ~$1650
Any additional funding will be directed towards creating more accessible community content such as explainers, blog posts, and open-source widgets.

project.title: $Earth - Solarpunk Dao
project.description:
Hey **Solarpunk**, stoked to have you here üåû

Our mission - **Put Eco in Economy**

Our Vision - **Seed the Solarpunk paradigm**

To make this happen we are building **$Earth** - A digital currency thats backed by real world climate assets, ecosystem services provided by those assets and solarpunk values.

[![c4be5546-9432-47eb-9701-539a9463e73d-logo-1.png](https://i.postimg.cc/wj5qjVNW/c4be5546-9432-47eb-9701-539a9463e73d-logo-1.png)](https://postimg.cc/gxJFM3NR)


# $Earth leverages crypto-economics and blockchain to -

1. Mobilize and incentivize primary finance for projects in the following sectors that are building infrastructure for an absolute zero emission future and address the massive climate finance gap of over $4-5 Trillion/yr needed to do so :

- **Clean Energy**‚òÄÔ∏è
- **Regenerative Agriculture**üå±
- **Clean Transport**‚ö°
- **Ecosystem Conservation**üêÜ
- **Solarpunk Spaces**üåá


2. Create pricing mechanisms to **value natural ecosystems and their services** while creating a monetary system that is backed by assets catering to our core needs

3. Program **solarpunk values** into a currency


[![0-1-3.png](https://i.postimg.cc/8cGrXbqx/0-1-3.png)](https://postimg.cc/sQnXv5fJ)


# To make this happen, $Earth has been designed to -

1. Incentivize degens, regens, treegens and solarpunks to **purge their petro $$$ for $Earth** which has a floating, range bound currency design. $Earth holders then use Quadratic Voting to determine which verified projects get funded via the treasury.

2. Inherently ascribing value to ecosystem services created by the projects we fund, by selling $Earth at a premium to the $ value of projects in the neoliberal world.

$Earth acts as a **new unit of value** for the $ value of the projects in our treasury + potential yields these projects will generate + the positive externalities created by these projects ( healthy soil, carbon sequestration, clean air, biodiversity etc) + solarpunk values it manifests

3. Generating utility for $Earth by creating a **network of regenerative/solarpunk merchants** who are willing to provide their goods and services in exchange of $Earth.

# Due to your incredible support in the Beta round where we managed to come 4th from 102 participants we were able to -

1. Finally register our entity from which we can officially issue $Earth.
2. Pay for our legal tool kit which contains important documents such as Terms of Service, Privacy policy, KYC/AML policy to offer $Earth.
3. Pay our devs
4. Hire an intern to help us with community building and operations
5. Keep aside a smol budget for marketing and promoting $Earth once we launch ( hopefully done by the time you are reading this)
6. Launch our #SolarpunkUniverse NFT collection where we are creating bespoke Solarpunk characters, a truly one of its kind NFT collection
7. Continue survivng the bear and working full time on this project
8. Initiate payment for KYC services and pay for AI tools like Midjourney, Kaiber

# Solarpunk #16,17 and 19 from our #SolarpunkUniverseNFT collection

[![Screenshot-2023-08-04-192309.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/c1THNZYv/Screenshot-2023-08-04-192309.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/QV9sp2fD)

# With the funds expected from this round we will be working on -

1. Creating a smart contract that serves as an aqueduct for $Earth, where lending/borrowing platform and Dexes will be able to let their users redirect yields earned from there towards minting/staking $Earth
2. Hire solarpunks to help us with content creation, community management and provide us with Credit Risk recommendations on the projects that $Earth treasury intends to fund
3. Launch 2 more NFT collections that will also serve as aqueducts for $Earth and assist in community building.
4. Create a subsidiary entity that interacts with real world entities and holds our investment deeds
5. Pay a designer to create a new version of the website+dapp
6. Initiate dialouge with aligned partners whose projects we seek to fund and have them serve as collateral for $Earth.
7. Keep a budget to market and promote $Earth
8. Hopefully to be able to conduct an IRL event to shill $Earth


Would be important to mention here that we are on the verge of launching $Earth on mainnet and this has been made possible only because of all the love from our contributors and incredible support from Gitcoin. 

We are extremely grateful for this  and are working tirelessly to deliver the solarpunk future üôè

project.title: ChainPray
project.description:
## Introduction
When you step into ChainPray, this unique blockchain prayer platform, you will discover **a world full of warmth and care**. Unlike those projects solely focused on wealth and profits, ChainPray chooses to turn its attention to ordinary users in the cryptocurrency community who have been affected by hackers, bad actors, and liquidations, providing them with heartfelt spiritual support to make them feel truly cared for and supported.

ChainPray ingeniously blends traditional prayers with advanced blockchain technology. On this magical platform, every user has the right to **claim one "PrayLuck" (PrayLuck Coin) for free every day**. By activating the daily prayer feature, users receive blessings from the blockchain, starting their day with positivity and goodness. This precious gift allows you to feel the platform's thoughtfulness and care.

In addition, ChainPray offers many exciting and meaningful additional features, such as "**Destiny Pray**", "**GoodMan Contributions**", "**God Competitions**", and "**Sunny Award**". These features not only add fun but also make you experience the colorful and wonderful aspects of life.

## Token Pass System
ChainPray's token economy consists of two tokens, **PrayLuck** and **PrayLuckStar**, along with the issuance of **NFTs** with different attributes. PrayLuckStar is obtained by users through the probability of "Destiny Pray", and the more times users pray, the more accumulated luck they have, making it easier to obtain PrayLuckStar. ChainPray also releases NFTs with various attributes to help users acquire PrayLuckStar more easily. For detailed information, please refer to the TokenPlan section on the [ChainPray official website](https://chainpray.com).

## Profit and Rewards
ChainPray's mission is not limited to providing spiritual support to cryptocurrency users. During the project's operation, **DAO will regularly distribute the "Sunny Award" of PrayLuck to random ChainPray users**. This portion of PrayLuck comes entirely from users' prayer consumption, reflecting a concept of "**taking from the people, giving back to the people.**" In the later stages of the ChainPray project, PrayLuckStar obtained through Destiny Prayers will have various consumer use cases, such as purchasing advertising space on ChainPray, issuing chain-wide announcements, buying unique NFTs, and more. Therefore, ChainPray will generate profits, and **the DAO will continue to use a significant portion of the profits to carry out "Sunny Award" for random ChainPray users**.

## Team
ChainPray's backend team boasts 5 years of experience in the internet industry and **5 years of experience in blockchain development**. Additionally, the smart contract development team has **4 years of experience specifically in Ethereum smart contracts**. The smart contracts used by ChainPray are developed using **Solidity**, ensuring simplicity and have undergone a thorough audit by multiple seasoned smart contract developers with years of experience in the cryptocurrency community. This ensures that **there are no contract security issues present**.

## Invitation card
We sincerely invite you to personally experience the unique charm of ChainPray and let your soul be nurtured and enlightened. ChainPray looks forward to sharing unforgettable moments with you, creating beautiful and heartwarming memories together. On this platform filled with blessings and care, let us embark on an unforgettable journey together.

project.title: 0x Salon
project.description:
**Fau0x Salon Governance RPG Card Deck**

We at the 0x Salon have developed a non-Web3-specific card game (Fau0x Salon, 2021) which serves as a discursive tool for participants to role-play post-disciplinary conversations from a variety of perspectives. The card deck "pops-up" salon-style events (intimate and diverse peer-group discussions) with some facilitation, allowing participants to role-play through problems, topics, and governance tensions from the perspectives of fictional character archetypes rather than themselves. We have been invited to present the Fau0x Salon project in an exhibition in Switzerland in November. The 2021 version of the card deck is here: https://www.are.na/0x-salon/wip-salon-deck-v2

We would like to prepare a Web3-specific version of this card deck, and seek contributions to help us with R&D, design, playtest, and production costs. Our goal is to complete a new version of the deck, do a series of playtests and workshops at Web3 events, make many hard copies available, and open-source the deck so that anyone can print their own copy and play.

In a way, we are developing a "Web3 governance therapy tool" ÔªøüöÄÔªø. One problem we are trying to solve is around the 'eternal September' problem of welcoming new people into the Web3 ecosystem with nuanced and unbiased information. There's also a related challenge, in the 'governance' of the human organisations that necessarily form around decentralised protocols, such as foundations, startups, benefactors, investors, as well as developers, miners / validators / service providers, users, ‚Ä¶. Due to the complex balance of stakeholder incentives in Ethereum and other Web3 networks, individual stakeholders may not be incentive-aligned, which can lead to ‚Äúoff-chain tensions‚Äù or even adversarial behaviour that is detrimental to the protocol.

Due to these somewhat split loyalties, and the distributed nature of many Web3 project teams, time spent together IRL (where communication is most effective) is scarce. Having a ‚Äúgovernance RPG‚Äù as a tool for teams to role-play through scenarios would enable team members to work through points of tension, without bringing their own personal characters or desiderata into the equation.  

**About the 0x Salon**
0x Salon is a collective endeavour which critically interrogates digital culture ‚Äî primarily that of the blockchain community ‚Äî through discourse events and residencies, producing scholarly and creative interventions in the process. 

Since 2020, we have been hosting salons ‚Å†‚Äî intimate post-disciplinary discussions ‚Å†‚Äî on a range of conversation topics. We are conducting an ongoing, non-profit experiment in knowledge sharing and collective cultural production. 

Stewarded by 0x Salon team members, our community researches topics, organises events, and produces lore, critical theory, poetry, philosophy, games, theatre, and visual art. Our website principally functions as a transmedia archival space, chronicling discussions within the 0x Salon and the resulting activities.

0x Salon is a collective endeavour which critically interrogates digital culture through discourse events and residencies, producing scholarly and creative interventions in the process. Since 2020, we have been hosting salons ‚Å†‚Äî intimate post-disciplinary discussions ‚Å†‚Äî on a range of conversation topics. Stewarded by 0x Salon team members, our community researches topics, organises events, and produces lore, critical theory, poetry, philosophy, games, theatre, and visual art. Our website principally functions as a transmedia archival space, chronicling discussions within the 0x Salon and the resulting activities.

///

Wassim Z. Alsindi PhDWassim is the founder and creative director of the 0x Salon, which conducts experiments in post-disciplinary collective knowledge practices. A veteran of the timechain, Wassim specialises in conceptual design and philosophy of peer-to-peer systems, on which he writes, speaks, teaches, and consults. He has an editorial column at the MIT Computational Law Report, and he co-founded MIT‚Äôs Cryptoeconomic Systems journal and conference series. Wassim has curated arts festivals, led a sculptural engineering laboratory and published experimental music, satirical theatre, poetry, and speculative scripture. Wassim holds a Ph.D. in ultrafast supramolecular photophysics from the University of Nottingham.

project.title: DataBites
project.description:
We give researchers the data they need by providing them to access high quality curated datatsets of on-chain data.  

## Current Status

We are currently building our MVP. Pulling data from our first API, we have built our database, and are reviewing the data we have pulled to determine its usefulness and accuracy.

We will begin to build the automated agent that serves to construct our curated datasets and update them automatically every 30 days for Ocean Marketplace.

We will sell our datasets on Ocean Marketplace for very low prices.  Once the PoC has been validated, we will apply for a grant via Ocean Protocol Shipyard.  With additional funds, alongside tapping into more API's and building more curated datasets, we will  build an AI Model that will allow subscribers to query the datatsets and derive insight from them. (see #3 in Growth Strategies below)

### **Target Audience:**

Data scientists (specifically web3 for MVP)

AI Builders

Token Engineers

**The Problem(s):** 

Existing on-chain data providers offer data through APIs:

Disadvantages:

- Require technical expertise to use (can be a barrier for others that lack technical expertise)
- Data is often raw and unfiltered
- Time-consuming to extract meaningful insights (This can involve cleaning the data, dealing with missing or inconsistent data, aggregating data, calculating metrics, and so on. ) Can be a barrier for those that lack time

### **DataBites Benefits:**

1. DataBites provides curated datasets, saving users the time and effort of data extraction and cleaning.

project.title: EVMcrispr
project.description:
[EVMcrispr](https://evmcrispr.com) is a comprehensive tool designed to simplify interactions with smart contracts on EVM-compatible chains. **It enables users to send transactions using intuitive, UNIX-like commands**, allowing for the creation of complete scripts that perform multiple arbitrary actions from the injected wallet in the web browser. This makes it easier to write complex scripts for various day-to-day blockchain operations, such as creating efficient DAO votes, launching and managing DAO configurations, performing DeFi strategies, running simulations on drafted on-chain actions, and creating, sending, and managing tokens.

EVMcrispr effectively lowers the technical barriers for web3 users to engage in and execute complex tasks using smart contracts. The tool's **domain-specific language is useful for expressing and transforming transaction data**. It has been adopted by organizations like Curve, Aragon, NFTX, 1Hive, Giveth, TECommons, BrightId, and Agave to conduct intricate votes within their Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAOs).

The tool boasts a terminal-like interface, complemented by clear documentation and numerous examples, making it easy for users to start. **It eliminates the need for a customized frontend to interact with Ethereum**, as users can simply write and share scripts with others for execution.

## Examples

Here are examples of scripts that perform day-to-day ENS actions. You can find more examples on how to use EVMcrispr [in the documentation](https://evmcrispr.com).


#### How to set an avatar image for your ENS

![](https://i.imgur.com/ZR6ekSW.png)

[Open the terminal](https://evmcrispr.eth.limo/#/terminal/QmU6fkoE2sRXCqtDSy7ZcZu3wefq3XxwpSy5BH2juyRdT1)


#### How to set a lockup address
![](https://i.imgur.com/jsTsO6o.png)

[Open the terminal](https://evmcrispr.com/#/terminal/QmU8rZYn3azqEvVHX3KGAh9i8fMfLdnp8r5QegosZCThuN)


#### How to extend an ENS domain for 1 year
![](https://i.imgur.com/7EdnXXc.png)

[Open the terminal](https://evmcrispr.com/#/terminal/QmNvK7tRpBjh8Q11hZ9Rs8e477R2Wc8dSpbzPXqEXABXNG)

## Roadmap

EVMcrispr is committed to continuous improvement and expansion of its features. The following next steps have been identified to enhance the tool and user experience:

1.  **Bug fixing and improved error messages:** Addressing and resolving any existing issues or bugs in the current implementation, ensuring a seamless user experience. We are dedicated to refining error messages to better inform users about potential issues and failures.
2.  **Formal language specification:** Developing a well-defined and comprehensive formal language specification to provide clear guidance for users and facilitate future improvements. The language specification will also be useful for LLMs to program transactions properly.
3.  **Event handling and output integration:** Implementing event handling capabilities to enable better tracking and monitoring of smart contract events and transactions. The outputs of the events will be made available in the script to inform and initiate subsequent transactions.
4.  **Safe support:** Integrating support for Safe (formerly Gnosis Safe), a widely-used smart contract wallet, to further broaden EVMcrispr's compatibility and utility for users within the ecosystem.
5.  **Improved ENS support:** EVMcrispr will make ENS names first-class citizens of the domain-specific language. The tool already supports the `namehash` function, and the `contenthash` function will be added to enhance ENS-related capabilities.

By focusing on these key areas, EVMcrispr aims to become an even more versatile and valuable tool for interacting with smart contracts on EVM-compatible chains.

The source code for EVMcrispr can be found in [this repository](https://github.com/EVMcrispr/evmcrispr) under the GPLv3 license.

project.title: HarbergerToken - A Decentraliazed Infra for Sustainable Funding of Open Source Proj.
project.description:
HarbergerToken is an innovative open-source project token solution based on blockchain technology that aims to address the long-standing sustainability issue faced by open-source communities. Anyone, including the open-source project owner, can create an HBG Token for any open-source project. Through the tax mechanism and risk-free mortgage feature, HBG Token provides a mutually beneficial ecosystem for open-source projects and investors. __Core features include risk-free mortgage, high capital utilization (up to 60x for early buyers), and the tax mechanism.__

The tax rights are assetized into two types of NFTs: Create NFT and Owner NFT. Create NFT has a 5% tax allocation right obtained by the person who creates the HBG Token (the creation price is GitHub stars multiplied by 0.1 $FIND; open-source project owners can create for free). Owner NFT has a 95% tax allocation right, and open-source project owners can claim it for free. The income before the Owner NFT is claimed belongs to the platform.

![NFT](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/105170140/231097911-4baa40b0-667d-418b-9d9b-b9a0afc81c7c.jpg)

HBG Token adopts an issuance method without reservation, where all tokens are placed in the Uniswap pool and cannot be withdrawn. This issuance method makes the liquidity more secure, and there is no liquidity risk.

The risk-free mortgage feature of HarbergerToken allows users to borrow $FIND & $ETH tokens by mortgaging HBG Tokens, which enables low-risk capital gains. For early buyers, HarbergerToken can also provide up to 60x capital utilization, greatly improving the efficiency of capital utilization. This efficient capital utilization not only reduces investors' risks but also creates more value for open-source projects.

In summary, HarbergerToken is committed to providing continuous financial support for open-source projects while also providing investors with a highly promising trading asset. Through risk-free lending, high capital utilization, and innovative tax mechanisms, HarbergerToken becomes an ideal bridge between open-source projects and investors.

answers.question: Describe how your project contributes to token engineering and why is it a valuable public good.
answers.answer:
HarbergerToken introduces an innovative blend of Harberger taxes and the functionality of Uniswap, aiming to revolutionize the relationship between open-source and finance. Our token issuance mechanism, especially with the creation of two NFTs (Create NFT and Owner NFT) representing tax collection rights, is a pioneering step in the blockchain space. By leveraging Uniswap V3 features, we've successfully implemented a risk-free lending function, eliminating issues like the death spiral. This no-risk, no-interest, no-liquidation lending offers up to 67x capital efficiency, potentially jump-starting open-source projects.
Furthermore, our project inherently promotes a positive-sum game, where the HBG token's price reflects the community's consensus on an open-source project. This financial motivation encourages active community participation in testing, documentation, sharing, and even operations, resulting in a closely-knit community.
In essence, HarbergerToken not only pushes the envelope in token engineering but also fosters community building, collaboration, and sustainable growth in open-source projects. As a public good, it offers both tangible financial incentives and intangible social benefits to its community.

Both our front-end and back-end are live at https://harberger.money/ and https://app.harberger.money/. Additionally, our contracts have been deployed on the Ethereum mainnet, and detailed information can be found on our GitHub repository at https://github.com/0xfind/0xfind. While our initial offering is functional, we recognize the need for further refinement, enhancements, and community growth, which we aim to address in the next phases.

project.title: TurtleShell
project.description:
# on-chain realtime hack prevention

### we are building on-chain firewalls

---

## What is an On-Chain Smart Contract Firewall?

Smart contract hacks have been plaguing DeFi protocols, bridges, and more.

Today, in order to defend themselves, protocols perform audits, open bug bounties, and implement monitoring.

All of these steps are absolutely crucial. Nevertheless, whenever a vulnerability is discovered by an attacker, most exploits can drain funds in a very short period of time, sometimes even within a single transaction. To prevent these hacks from happening, we need an on-chain tool.

You can think of the Smart Contract Firewall as an additional layer of security for DeFi protocols.

Our Firewall is a set of Solidity Smart Contracts that allow you to:

- Define critical parameters for your protocol (e.g., TVL) and track these parameters over time.
- Detect that a transaction (or multiple) is causing the protocol to operate outside its normal activity (e.g., unusual liquidity outflow, indicative of a potential hack happening).
- Implement a set of protective measures, including transaction blocking, protocol pausing, fund freezing, or controlled fund withdrawal, before the transaction is committed and funds exit the protocol.

The Firewall provides a way to detect abnormal changes in your protocol directly on-chain, that could be indicative of a hack. That means that you can act upon abnormal activity, whenever it occurs, directly on the blockchain.

---

## Our Roadmap

### **Phase 1: Research & Proof-of-Concept**

- **Estimated Duration:** 1 Month
- **Estimated delivery date:** 30th August 2023

This phase will focus on in-depth research and the creation of proof-of-concepts demonstrating how tailored firewall can enhance the security and functionality of protocols.

### Milestone 2: Prototyping & Production

- **Estimated Duration:** 2 Months
- **Estimated delivery date:** 30th October 2023

The second phase will concentrate on the development and testing of firewall prototypes based on the findings of the first phase. The prototypes will showcase the practicality and benefits of integrating on-chain firewalls into DeFi Protocols.

### Milestone 3: Testnet Deployment
- **Estimated Duration:** 1 Month
- **Estimated delivery date:** 30th November 2023

## The final phase will involve the testnet deployment of all firewall components, followed by rigorous testing and refinement to ensure the system is ready for potential mainnet audits and protocol implementations.

## **Our Goals**

- Reliability
- Inexpensive in gas terms. The overhead must remain negligible.
- Not adding complexity to the protected contract(s): Implementing the Firewall must not require more than a few lines of Solidity code.
- It must scale

---

# TL;DR ‚§µÔ∏è

## **How Does It Work?**

**You can track any critical metric that could be indicative of an exploit happening for your protocol.**

### Let's take the example of TVL:

Every time there is an inflow or outflow of liquidity, you add a call to the Firewall contract to track the TVL at this point in time within your protocol. The Firewall will keep a history of your TVL over time.
This allows you to define a threshold so that if more than X% of the TVL exits the protocol in less than Y number of blocks, the Firewall triggers.
When this happens, the Firewall status is updated before the transaction is committed, which allows you to implement a set of defensive strategies to prevent the transaction from going through, such as rejecting the transaction or freezing the funds.

All of this happens synchronously, at the contract level in Solidity. This means that exploits are prevented from happening automatically, and directly on-chain.

You can find a more detailed explanation of the Firewall [here](https://turtleshell.gitbook.io/introduction/how-it-works).

### **Protective Measures**

Once the Firewall gets triggered, protocols can use it in various ways to protect their assets. Here are some of the protective measures that can be taken:

![](https://file.notion.so/f/s/56e03ba6-c890-4df6-8063-6b922adce341/firewall_triggered.svg?id=0df407f8-b92c-40bd-bbb0-27c2d94cb8f2&table=block&spaceId=549a06fc-7073-4a4a-a8f1-3206b15135b8&expirationTimestamp=1691712000000&signature=4DUMvFXQlMfGejNNjJNO3gfV2P985i2wzAOK2NnxRic&downloadName=firewall_triggered.svg)
___
## **Implementation and Integration**

1. **Setup configuration**: Define the parameter you want to track (e.g: TVL) and a maximum threshold that should not be reached within a custom time period.
2. **Identify Entry Points**: This step consists of listing functions that affect your parameter. For TVL, that would be functions that increase or decrease liquidity (e.g., deposit & withdraw).
3. **Integrate the Firewall**: For each entry point, you must add a single line of code to call the Firewall to track this parameter.
4. **Choose and Implement a Defensive Strategy**: Every time you call the firewall, it returns its status. If the firewall triggers, you implement one of our strategies: reject transaction, freeze funds, pause protocol, etc.
5. **Monitor and Adjust**: After integration, you can monitor the operation of the firewall and adjust the parameters as needed. This allows you to fine-tune the system to better protect your protocol.

Remember, the key to effective use of the Firewall is understanding your protocol's specific needs and adjusting the parameters accordingly. With the right configuration, the Firewall can provide a robust line of defence against potential hacks and unauthorized fund withdrawals.

### What does a Solidity integration look like?

```solidity
function withdraw(uint256 withdrawAmount) external override {
	[...]
	// Firewall implementation
	bool firewallTriggered = IFirewall(firewall).decreaseParameter(withdrawAmount);
	if (firewallTriggered) return;
	[...]
}
```

---

# Why it is important what we build

Most established exploit prevention procedures like performing security audits are important, yet, we must understand that these have limitations and cannot asses risks beyond code produced by the engineering team. External dependencies as potential attack vectors are frequently being disregarded or *assumed* to be safe, as they lies outside a single protocol‚Äôs spectrum of actionable security measures. Given the example of the most recent curve exploit: Auditing legacy versions of the Vyper compiler, was undoubtably out of the protocol‚Äôs security scope.

![](https://file.notion.so/f/s/85dbe180-0f88-43d0-b684-3f5ddc7ee6d7/no_firewall.svg?id=2fd27862-22c1-449b-81bf-c117ffccb8d1&table=block&spaceId=549a06fc-7073-4a4a-a8f1-3206b15135b8&expirationTimestamp=1691683200000&signature=PS-S6gi09av2Uy1msnYxh3AwuDbYIgL69Ki0CaGgYks&downloadName=no_firewall.svg)

Even when exploring hypothetical scenarios, e.g.: All protocols using Vyper coming together beforehand and collectively sourcing audits for Vyper versions 0.2.15, 0.2.16, and 0.3.0, it still would not have solved the underlying problem: The *unknown (un)knowns* of vulnerable external dependencies. Given the infinite amount of unknowns, it is merely impossible to effectively draw the line between where to start and stop security audits.

![](https://file.notion.so/f/s/abea7062-fba8-4f89-a092-2bd3acc966a9/no_firewall_cycle.svg?id=7c4d140d-5252-4bdb-9b52-87f9d0b3d111&table=block&spaceId=549a06fc-7073-4a4a-a8f1-3206b15135b8&expirationTimestamp=1691683200000&signature=AsCb8siZEWEKliqMvSBaoxR5475sCUusyNiHfVYeEHk&downloadName=no_firewall_cycle.svg)

This is why protocols have to hope for the best while keeping their fingers crossedü§ûonce deploying code to production. In essence: Hoping they won‚Äôt have to face any *unknown (un)knowns* in production, but if so, hopefully only through bug bounties programs and whitehats. Usually, the financial incentives for blackhat hackers largely outweigh bug bounty initiatives, leading to exploits of undiscovered attack vectors. Furthermore, in accordance to Murphy‚Äôs Law, the above strategy would lead to a hack in any case, sooner or later.

---

## Actionable opportunities to protect the protocol

### Adding Firewalls to the protocols production deployments

As an additional layer of protection to the protocol Firewalls can be added to mitigate in-production risks.

![](https://file.notion.so/f/s/d657a457-f1ff-466e-9fda-834e5e2b6960/firewall_cycle.svg?id=d1fea3f9-a839-40f7-8e72-4dcc0498d5e8&table=block&spaceId=549a06fc-7073-4a4a-a8f1-3206b15135b8&expirationTimestamp=1691683200000&signature=Y4vDfcAEbwx3fLlS0yTAleP-XeC7qrADIJVLCKWOn8I&downloadName=firewall_cycle.svg)

***Even tough, the way the protocol gets exploited relies on an unknown (un)known, the target of the exploit always is a KNOWN KNOWN, being liquidity.***

![](https://file.notion.so/f/s/cd611ba0-e6e6-44e4-a1c4-092a1877ed5a/unknown.svg?id=d9fd796b-f684-407b-a9ab-785bf935a8fc&table=block&spaceId=549a06fc-7073-4a4a-a8f1-3206b15135b8&expirationTimestamp=1691683200000&signature=Rs29pxwyQ4EgZG8_SRs_YACvA148i-9veTuyPF15XMY&downloadName=unknown.svg)

**‚Üí Therefore, we can work with the known characteristics of every exploit happening, instead of trying to solve what we cannot know.**

![](https://file.notion.so/f/s/9718190a-5d8d-4a1a-8247-bf489d4d1dc8/known.svg?id=ac678746-28bf-476b-a468-33cfd9666b0d&table=block&spaceId=549a06fc-7073-4a4a-a8f1-3206b15135b8&expirationTimestamp=1691683200000&signature=qYYMfTnH_9NG-nOIhB7OW1KUd9pdzw-cqtipj4sHQxM&downloadName=known.svg)

We are aware of the attackers target: extracting Liquidity.

We are aware of external dependencies, will most likely lead the attacker to his target.

***‚Üí knowing and understanding these two crucial pieces of information, we can design a security system around these two vectors.***

![](https://file.notion.so/f/s/a001b4cf-e63b-4571-a210-9aa9c2f0014b/firewall.svg?id=28da97a7-5a30-4082-a7fb-3614752aa556&table=block&spaceId=549a06fc-7073-4a4a-a8f1-3206b15135b8&expirationTimestamp=1691683200000&signature=0wuyiOSBTjiTbHH2yNWtAeakYUduNI0-zZumI-bavD0&downloadName=firewall.svg)

As a wrapped layer of security around the protocol, the attacker will not be able to reach his intended target: *extracting liquidity*, with *external dependencies* as his attack vector. Even when vulnerabilities occur (e.g. faulty compilers), an attacker will not reach his target, as the Firewall system operates as an independent layer of security for the protocol.

Whenever abnormal activity occurs, on-chain Firewall‚Äôs offer a range of protective measures, including blocking of transactions, pausing the protocol, freezing of funds, or controlled fund withdrawal, thereby providing a robust on-chain defence against potential hacks.

## Resources:

- [Twitter](https://twitter.com/turtleshell_xyz)
- [Team‚Äôs Website](https://turtleshell.xyz/)
- [Docs](https://turtleshell.gitbook.io/)
- [Team‚Äôs Github Organization](https://github.com/ikigai-labs-xyz/turtleshell-core)
- [Demo Repository](https://github.com/ikigai-labs-xyz/turtleshell-core)
- [relevant Firewall Demo of a L&B Market](https://www.loom.com/share/f6981c21abd54afc8b29565de1d3ea3a?t=2)

answers.question: What specific problem(s) do you seek to solve with this grant, and how will you know whether you have accomplished your goal(s)?
answers.answer:
Smart contract hacks have been plaguing DeFi protocols, bridges, and more.

Today, in order to defend themselves, protocols perform audits, open bug bounties, and implement monitoring.

All of these steps are absolutely crucial. Nevertheless, whenever a vulnerability is discovered by an attacker, most exploits can drain funds in a very short period of time, sometimes even within a single transaction. To prevent these hacks from happening, we need an on-chain tool.

You can think of the Smart Contract Firewall as an additional layer of security for DeFi protocols.

Our Firewall is a set of Solidity Smart Contracts that allow you to:

- Define critical parameters for your protocol (e.g., TVL) and track these parameters over time.
- Detect that a transaction (or multiple) is causing the protocol to operate outside its normal activity (e.g., unusual liquidity outflow, indicative of a potential hack happening).
- Implement a set of protective measures, including transaction blocking, protocol pausing, fund freezing, or controlled fund withdrawal, before the transaction is committed and funds exit the protocol.

The Firewall provides a way to detect abnormal changes in your protocol directly on-chain, that could be indicative of a hack. That means that you can act upon abnormal activity, whenever it occurs, directly on the blockchain.

___

We'll know our project was a success when we observe increased adoption rates, reduced security incidents in the token ecosystem, and receive positive feedback from the community, signaling enhanced trust and robustness in the DeFi space.

Best case scenario:

A protocol is under attack, but was able to block the attack with the firewall integration.

project.title: Commons Stack
project.description:
# üí°TL;DR

Help us enable more communities to fund and govern their mission! With Gitcoin donations, we will continue **providing blueprints and tools for impact communities to realize economic sustainability and shared resource governance**.

Leveraging our success with the [Augmented Bonding Curve](https://medium.com/commonsstack/deep-dive-augmented-bonding-curves-b5ca4fad4436) and [Economic Co-design](https://medium.com/commonsstack/a-non-violent-revolution-against-technocracy-53388b123936) for the [Token Engineering Commons (TEC)](https://tecommons.org/), we aim to further enable more communities to launch their own economies by refining, documenting, and promoting our open-source tools and protocols for creating **sustainable token economies and equitable governance system**. 

Donate to Commons Stack and support our solutions for funding, governance and public goods management.

Thank you for your generosity! üôè


# üåé ABOUT COMMONS STACK

We innovate at the intersection between culture and token engineering!

Commons Stack builds technical tools and cultural frameworks that enable impact initiatives to evolve into decentralized, regenerative, self-governing communities. Our expertise lies in guiding communities through the process of creating an organizational structure that facilitates active participation, cooperation, and accountability. You can build a community-driven ecosystem that fosters positive change and ensures your project‚Äôs long-term success.

These four pillars present our approach to funding, governance, and public goods management:

**Cultural frameworks:**  We provide comprehensive cultural frameworks that empower impact-focused communities to form, fundraise, and govern effectively, ensuring their long-term success. These frameworks are designed to accommodate the unique needs and challenges of DAOs, offering flexible, research-based solutions that respect both collective and individual autonomy.

**Economics Co-design:** We champion Economic Co-design, a methodology that promotes inclusion, transparency, and active participation, enabling community members to create their own economic design proposals. This ensures diverse perspectives are heard, fostering the growth of innovative and practical solutions tailored to community needs through a 3-step process: educate, propose, and vote.

**Research:** We conduct research to innovate collective governance and economic design tools for web3. Our research-led approach allows us to create adaptable templates that cater to the unique needs of diverse communities.

**Library of Tools:** We curate a library of tools, comprised of modular, interoperable solutions that empower communities to fund projects and establish regenerative token economies. These tools, including the Augmented Bonding Curve and Conviction Voting, facilitate the launch of CommonsDAO and complement the creation of a sustainable, polycentric governance model.


# ü§ù OUR COMMITMENT TO OPEN SOURCE

Open source fosters a culture of collaboration, knowledge sharing, and mutual respect. It gives builders worldwide access to tools and resources that collectively drive research and social and technological advancements.

We champion a culture of radical openness as we believe transparency advances projects and productivity ethically and inclusively. We actively practice the philosophy of open source by building in public.


# üì£ UPDATES SINCE GITCOIN BETA ROUND

üöÄ **Website Launch:** Our new website is live! We‚Äôve spent the last couple of months reflecting on our culture, our mission and our work. Our new website highlights our mission and presents our work more clearly. Have a look: [https://www.commonsstack.org/](https://www.commonsstack.org/).  

![Commons Stack‚Äôs new website](https://imgur.com/pxwBYVm.png) 

üß∞ **CommonsDAO Toolkit:** We‚Äôve been in pursuit of more funding to expand the reach of our CommonsDAO tooling, including the ABC and Conviction voting. We‚Äôve been recently selected for Optimism Cycle 13 Builder Grant to extend our innovative CommonsDAO tooling, along with the Aragon DAO formation and management tooling, to the Optimism chain. The result will allow any community on Optimism to easily launch their own ABC! 

üó£Ô∏è **Event Talks:** We‚Äôve been actively sharing our knowledge and insights at ETHBarcelona and EthCC. Our team delivered key presentations addressing crucial topics like token engineering, the power of myths, and the concept of a market for public goods. Watch the [full playlist](https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLy6j39s17_jQRNO4vli-3WGZ8RaivFqLM) of our talks.

![Livia Deschermayer at ETHCC 2023](https://imgur.com/W2wiPwr.png) 


![Tamara Helenius at ETHCC 2023](https://imgur.com/eM7ta2g.png) 


![Griff Green at ETHCC 2023](https://imgur.com/4M0bO2k.png) 


# üí∞ PLANS FOR GG18 ROUND FUNDING

Funding from this round will support our ongoing initiative - porting the Aragon client and  CommonsDAO tooling to Optimism chain. We received a 40K OP token grant from Optimism for this piece of work but (1) it does not actually cover the full scope of work and (2) the tokens will be locked for one year. Donations now will help us bridge that gap. This project is important because it lays the technical foundation for the TEC, should the community decide, to migrate to the Optimism chain. Additionally, it will allow projects and communities on Optimism to deploy their own Augmented Bonding Curve (ABC). 

The success of this project will extend our CommonsDAO tooling to the Optimism community. This means **more projects gaining access to our innovative tools and ability to launch an ABC** to fund and govern their missions, empowering them to create sustainable token economies and effective governance models. We are working with our partners, Blossom Labs and General Magic, to realize this work.

In addition to supporting our specific projects, the funding from GG18 will provide a much-needed boost to our overall operations, particularly in navigating the challenges of the bear market. üêª  We believe in the resilience and potential of the Commons Stack community, and with your support, we can continue to innovate and drive impact, regardless of market conditions.


# üë• OUR TEAM

We are committed to fostering an inclusive work environment and prioritizing diversity and inclusion. Our team is 80% female team! And we span diverse cultural and geographic backgrounds, including **women from the Philippines, Brazil, Argentina and US/France**. 

[Tamara Helenius](https://twitter.com/tamarandom) - Tamara is a co-founder of Commons Stack,  and a former steward and current advisor for the Token Engineering Commons (TEC). She has extensive experience leading large scale digital media programs and management consulting, with former roles at Capgemini, TheStreet, Google and Sony Music.

[Livia Deschermayer](https://twitter.com/_liviade) - Researcher and Cultural Build Lead at Commons Stack, TEC steward 

[Ivy Bagay](https://twitter.com/iviangita) - Ivy leads operations at Commons Stack and marketing at Trusted Seed and is an active Board Member at the Trusted Seed Association. In addition to her current roles, Ivy has made significant contributions as a previous steward in the Transparency WG of the Token Engineering Commons. 

[Emilia Regen](https://twitter.com/MowgliRegen) - Emilia is a brand strategist and creative director with a background in architecture, impact strategy, design, and education. She is committed to regenerating the earth as a climate activist with Extinction Rebellion movement and ReFi DAO Barcelona.

[Griff Green](https://twitter.com/thegrifft) - Co-founder of Giveth, Commons Stack, Praise, General Magic & DAppNode! Top Steward in ENS, Gitcoin, Optimism, Arbitrum, TEC as well as many other Ethereum community projects. Been DAOing his heart out since 2015.

[Ivy Bagay](https://twitter.com/iviangita) - Ivy leads operations at Commons Stack and marketing at Trusted Seed and is an active Board Member at the Trusted Seed Association. In addition to her current roles, Ivy has made significant contributions as a previous steward in the Transparency WG of the Token Engineering Commons. 

[Emilia Regen](https://twitter.com/MowgliRegen) - Emilia is a brand strategist and creative director with a background in architecture, impact strategy, design, and education. She is committed to regenerating the earth as a climate activist with Extinction Rebellion movement and ReFi DAO Barcelona.

answers.question: What specific problem(s) do you seek to solve with this grant, and how will you know whether you have accomplished your goal(s)?
answers.answer:
Emerging ReFi & DeFi startups and DAOs in general frequently struggle with securing ongoing funding due to market dynamics and liquidity challenges. Our tool, the Augmented Bonding Curve (ABC), addresses this by facilitating continuous funding and liquidity. However, ABC's technical complexity hinders its mass adoption, thereby limiting its ability to enhance liquidity, sustain funding for potential small-cap DAOs and startups, and promote broad acceptance of such token-governed technology.

By leveraging the powerful combination of upgraded AragonOS and ABCs, we intend to simplify the deployment process of these economic tools, making them more accessible and user-friendly. 

Our solution means empowering more projects to easily launch their own DAOs and microeconomies on Optimism and other chains in the future. This increased accessibility can democratize the DeFi space and foster sustainable economic growth.

answers.question: Describe how your project contributes to token engineering and why is it a valuable public good.
answers.answer:
Commons Stack contributes to the advancement of token engineering by creating sustainable commons-inspired token economies frameworks and the dashboards to parameterize them through open-source web3 tools and protocols. We helped launch the Token Engineering Commons (TEC) by developing its governance and funding structures, providing technical support for its Augmented Bonding Curve (ABC) configuration dashboard, and promoting collaboration among token engineers and researchers. Since its launch in mid-2021, the TEC has quickly become a thriving community, working together to fund and create better opportunities for token engineering projects. The $TEC token price has performed about as well as Ethereum, yet all the community has done is give out grants to Token Engineering Projects. 

We are seeking this funding to support our ongoing initiative to deploy the AragonOS and CommonsDAO tooling on Optimism. We will deploy complex DAO infrastructure to Optimism and novel new tools such as the Augmented Bonding Curve (ABC) and Tao Voting. This project will lay the groundwork for the token engineering community and Token Engineering Commons (TEC), should the community decide, to migrate from Gnosis to Optimism. One of the goals is to be able to migrate the TEC without writing any code.

answers.question: What stage do you consider your project is currently in? (PoC, MVP, fully integrated project, etc.)
answers.answer: The design template for the CommonsDAO has evolved beyond the initial MVP phase. We've integrated key insights into our latest designs, although they are yet to be implemented within a CommonsDAO context. Concurrently, for our other solutions, we remain steadfast in our commitment to research and analysis, ensuring continuous refinement and enhancement of their frameworks.

answers.question: Please share any new updates or milestones from the prior months.
answers.answer:
- We initiated a project to deploy AragonOS and CommonsDAO tooling to the Optimism chain. We're pleased to report steady progress, aligned with our projected milestones. This project is important because it will lay the technical foundation so that the TEC is able, should the community decide, to migrate to the Optimism chain.

- We've collaborated with the TEC on the Token Engineering Stakeholder Study, a comprehensive study of token engineers' roles, challenges, needs, and viewpoints.

- Our team remains engaged members of the Ethereum community, delivering thought-provoking talks at ETHBarcelona and ETHCC. Topics we've covered include token engineering, the significance of myths, and the idea of a market for public goods.

- We launched our rebranding, including a new website that better conveys our mission and simplifies our work and solutions. [We invite you to explore!](https://www.commonsstack.org/).

project.title: DeSpace QF: Public Goods Funding in Space
project.description:
# Project Title: DeSpace Quadratic Fund

## Abstract 

To align the Decentralized Space Exploration Ecosystem for public goods funding, we propose the DeSpace Quadratic Funding Grants Round. This initiative aims to raise and distribute funds to support the DeSpace ecosystem.

## DeSpace Examples: 
- DAOs
- NFT collections
- Metaverses
- Blockchain Nodes

## Background: 
In the previous community-driven [Decentralized Science Round on Gitcoin](https://explorer.gitcoin.co/#/round/1/0x6e8dc2e623204d61b0e59e668702654ae336c9f7), there was significant demand for Hardware & Decentralized Space Exploration projects. This round also laid the groundwork for the DeSpace QF because of intense preparations that built on top of the success of [DeSpace: Space Founder Circles](https://www.spacefoundercircles.com/) in collaboration with ReFiDAO. With the current momentum in the Web3 market, the project aims to fund public goods related to Outer Space using Quadratic Funding.

## Problem Statement: 
Startups and research projects often face challenges in securing initial funding and public awareness. For Public Goods projects, such as Open Space/Lunar, funding challenges can hinder long-term independence and the acceleration of innovative space technologies.

## Solution: 
The rising popularity of DeSpace presents an opportunity to establish a platform that unifies the broader DeSpace ecosystem with aligned values as outlined in the [DeSpace Manifesto](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YWnfN8l2VlQA-n5QxNH9oDdJ1soqe-_EaQmVfi_G_9g/). The DeSpace Quadratic Fund aims to achieve this.

## What is Decentralized Space Exploration: 
Decentralized Space Exploration is a sub-niche within web3 merging space exploration with decentralized systems. Instead of being dominated by major national space agencies or billionaires, this approach allows multiple entities or individuals to participate in space missions. Leveraging blockchain and community-driven initiatives, it promotes open-source technology, collective decision-making, and crowdfunding. This democratizes space activities, fostering inclusivity, sustainability, and innovation in Space by distributing control and participation across a broader community.

## Public Good Definition: 
A Public Good is non-excludable and non-rivalrous. In the context of the "DeSpace Quadratic Fund", it refers to projects that benefit the broader decentralized space exploration community.

## Quadratic Funding Explanation: 
Quadratic Funding (QF) is a democratic funding method for public goods. It prioritizes the number of contributors over the amount contributed, ensuring projects with broad community support receive appropriate funding.

## Benefits of Quadratic Funding for Space Public Goods: 
The first framework is proposed in the [DeSpace QF Lightpaper](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ygLWjt32Na3fCXvuruUyoNKaXqS3urfkr63FjnTPMo0/). Using QF for space-related public goods ensures projects with wide community backing receive amplified funding. This approach captures the public's desires and needs, making it ideal for supporting space-related public goods projects.

## Benefits: 
- Attract relevant DeSpace project audiences.
- Raise awareness across the DeSpace ecosystem.
- Position as a hub for the DeSpace ecosystem.
- Provide initial funding and promotion for researchers and projects.
- Create a Proof of Concept for Public Goods funding in Space Science.

## Risks: 
- Insufficient initial funding.
- Funding the wrong projects.
- Potential for fraud and Sybil attacks.
- High Gas Fees.
- Challenges in KPI measurements & user onboarding.

## Learnings from the Last Decentralized Science Round: 
The team will leverage tools like Gitcoin‚Äôs Passport and Sybill Analysis Toolkit, switch to Optimism for low Gas Fees, and involve the B2B team for engagement.

## Why this team? 
We aligned leading DeSpace innovators, scientists and entrepreneurs from Space DAOs like [MoonDAO](https://moondao.com/), [SpaceRoxDAO](https://spacerox.org/), [Alpha Persei](https://alphapersei.com/) and [SpaceDAO.AI](https://spacedao.ai/) to sit on one table, start this initiative and grow our ecosystem for the benefit of all!

We already committed advisors and supporters from [Copernic Space](https://copernicspace.com/), [Lunargistics](https://lunargistics.com/), [Axiom Space](https://www.axiomspace.com/) and [Astrocool](https://astrocool.com/) offering special perks to grantees or donors besides the Space DAOs already involved and more to be announced soon.

Confirmed grantees are companies mentioned before, as well as, [Orbuculum](https://dlteo.com/), [MoonSociety](https://www.moonsociety.org/), [Lunco](https://lunco.space/), Open Lunar Comms and many more to be confirmed soon.

## Objectives and Key Results: 
**Objective #1:** Conduct DeSpace QF Round on Gitcoin Grants Stack
**Key Results for Objective #1:** 
- Raise a minimum of $25k from sponsors.
- Draft Eligibility Criteria.
- Get at least 10 grantees on the platform.
- Facilitate the round.
- Plan and execute co-marketing.
- Build a DeSpace Cornerstone Fund for future Rounds

## Metrics to measure success: 
Matching Pool Fund size, number of grantees, number of donors, amount and number of donations, marketing engagement metrics, number of sponsors/advisors, cross-promotion activities by grantees.

## Founding Stewards: 
@ManuelOlariu
Manuel Olariu is the founder of DeepVenture.io and with Copernic Space he is building a space asset marketplace leading Innovation and IP standards. He is responsible for MoonDAO B2B while he is supporting various Decentralized Science and Decentralized Space activities. He led the last community-driven #GitcoinBeta Decentralized Science Grants Round utilizing Gitcoin's Grants Stack where MoonDAO played a critical part as the main initial sponsor of the Round.

@_Difint_
Rod Mamin is a systems engineer, with commercial experience building and sending robots to the Moon, Founder of LunCo.Space, Grantee on DeSci & Open Source Software Gitcoin‚Äôs GR15, Alpha Round, Beta Round and MoonDAOs Space Engineering Guild Initiator and Ex-Steward.

@PaulBurg_
Pavel Anisimov is an environmental scientist, with experience in public goods and decentralized communities. He is a Blockchain and space enthusiast and Founder of ReFi Phangan (GreenPill local chapter/ReFi DAO hub) and EcoSynthesisX

@Redotics
Red Boumghar is CEO of Parametry.ai, building SpaceDAO.AI with ESA, and graduated from Creative Destruction Lab.

@Adamjboyle
Adam Boyle is the founder of SpaceRoxDAO supporting public goods in Space and one of the Core members at Alpha Persei.

**Multi-sig Signers:**
@IonRod, @ManuelOlariu, @PaulBurg, @Red, @Adam @Ballack
oeth:0xde629289aBfDF973D3b845620Cf40F3c48c9627d

## Estimated Project Timeline: 
- **Aug 3, 2023:** Giveth page created.
- **Aug 15, 2023:** Min. 25k secured, first Round on Gitcoin announced.
- **Aug 29, 2023:** End of DeSpace Round.
- **Sep 15, 2023:** Sybill Analysis & Final results.
- **Sep 30, 2023:** Grantee Payouts.
- **Nov 1, 2023 / Ongoing:** Next DeSpace Round.

As "DeSpace QF," our project contributes to token engineering by leveraging blockchain technology and community-driven initiatives to promote open-source technology, collective decision-making, and crowdfunding in the space exploration sector. By utilizing quadratic funding, we prioritize the number of contributors over the amount contributed, ensuring that projects with broad community support receive appropriate funding.

This approach to token engineering is valuable as it democratizes space activities, fostering inclusivity, sustainability, and innovation in the space industry. By distributing control and participation across a broader community, we aim to capture the public's desires and needs, making it ideal for supporting space-related public goods projects.

Furthermore, our project serves as a hub for the DeSpace ecosystem, attracting relevant DeSpace project audiences and raising awareness across the community. By providing initial funding and promotion for researchers and projects, we create a proof of concept for public goods funding in space science.

In summary, our project's contribution to token engineering lies in its ability to democratize space activities, amplify funding for projects with wide community backing, and create a platform for innovation and collaboration in the space exploration sector.

answers.question: What stage do you consider your project is currently in? (PoC, MVP, fully integrated project, etc.)

We are in the process of establishing the DeSpace Quadratic Fund as a platform that unifies the broader DeSpace ecosystem with aligned values as outlined in the DeSpace Manifesto. While we have made significant progress in conceptualizing and designing the project, we are still in the early stages of implementation.  Our focus at this stage is to attract relevant DeSpace project audiences, raise awareness across the DeSpace ecosystem, and provide initial funding and promotion for researchers and projects. We are actively working on refining our strategies, engaging with the community, and exploring partnerships to ensure the success of the project.  While we are in the PoC stage, we are committed to continuously iterating and improving our platform based on user feedback and market demands. Our ultimate goal is to evolve into a fully integrated project that effectively supports space-related public goods and contributes to the growth and development of the DeSpace ecosystem. MVP with DeSci features Round and Space Founder Circles.

project.title: TE Career Builder for Womxn in Web 3
project.description:
**What‚Äôs our ambition?**

We are ultimately working towards building a token engineering career building platform serving womxn in web 3, such as:

https://www.adaslist.co/
https://www.stemwomen.org.au/

This platform will serve as a hub for womxn in web 3 looking to build careers in Token Engineering to access an online community, connect with other womxn in web 3 around the world, visualise their career roadmap and feel empowered in their journey to building careers as token engineers.

**Where are we now?**

We are currently running a study group for womxn in web 3 - bringing together a multi-disciplinary group of female and non-binary budding token engineers. Here is a snapshot of the academic/professional backgrounds of our participants:

Data Science - Law - Economics - Development - Innovation Policy - Design - Public Policy - Geography - Software Development - Behavioural Science - Finance - Physics - Maths -Business Development - Accountancy - Cybersecurity

As part of building our Womxn in Web 3 network, we capture our knowledge, discussions, insights and learnings on a collaborative MIRO board (https://miro.com/app/board/uXjVPJwvJDA=/) and arrange workshops with female and non binary speakers to inspire participants to pursue careers in token engineering. 

We recently conducted a workshop on Empowering Underrepresented Learners in Token Engineering at the recent Token Engineering Barcamp in Paris: https://youtu.be/f6vrvDp5OcQ. 

We represented 1 of 3 sessions delivered by female/non-binary individuals at the event, which had a total of 14 sessions. In this session, we shed light on the barriers faced by underrepresented learners and how we design our study group sessions to combat them:

1. Lack of Role Models

 - Arranging specific female & nb speaker sessions.
 - Finding accountability partners within the group.

2. Unequal Digital Literacy

- Designing an accessible/inclusive MIRO structure.

3. Imposter Syndrome

- Including space holding & story sharing time in sessions. 

- Co-writing blogs with other participants.

- Using practical case studies to cater for different learner types.

4. Limited Networking Opportunities

- Attending conferences as a group/community.

- Facilitating internship opportunities.


**How does the project support Public Goods?**

Bringing more female and non-binary voices into Token Engineering will support the development and design of public goods/systems which have a more holistic impact on society. 

These key systems thinking principles highlight why the gender gap impacts the design of public systems:

- **Holism:** The idea that systems are more than the sum of their parts, and should be studied as a whole. This means to understand a system and the actors it serves, the design of the system should be undertaken by the range of actors who will take part. 

- **Reflexivity:** The recognition that the observer or designer is part of the system and can influence its behaviour. To have a male-dominated design team will only perpetuate biases in objective setting and incentive design. 

- **Perspectives:** The understanding that different people have different perspectives and experiences of a system, and that these perspectives can shape its behavior and outcomes.

**What are the funds for?**

We are in the research and development stage of platform building. We‚Äôd like to formally work on building the study group for cohort 2 and are fundraising for the following:

- 3 days / 24 hours a week 
- 20 weeks (i.e. duration of the cohort Aug - Dec 2023) 
- Rate = 30 USD per hour 

Total cost for 480 hours @ 30 USD p/hour = USD 14,400

At this stage of our project, we are focusing on these key milestones:

*1. Womxn in Web 3 Skills Showcasing*: writing articles/conducting online speaker sessions.

*2. Career blueprinting*: formalising and visualising more nuanced career blueprints for underrepresented individuals. 

*3. Data Collection*: collecting data on the barriers faced by underrepresented groups at different stages of building careers in token engineering.  

*4. POC Development*: building a proof-of-concept for the platform

We measure success against the following outputs:

*1. Womxn in Web 3 Skills Showcasing*
- Medium blog with 20 followers. 

- 3 Online Events with average attendance of 20 (e.g. Twitter Spaces, Speaker Sessions)

- 2 workshop or speaker sessions on TE delivered by study group participants at in-person conferences/events (e.g. hosted by likeminded projects such as CryptoFemme)

*2. Career Blueprinting*
- Visual roadmap of a TE career blueprint in infographic form.

*3. Data Collection*
- Short report on barriers faced by cohort 2 participants in completing TE Fundamentals.

*4. POC Development*
- Platform Objectives
- Resources Needed
- Timeline for development
- Success criteria

If we don‚Äôt reach this fundraising goal, we will continue to run the study group and build our community. We will aim to focus on activities 2 and 3. 

Specifically, we will aim to gather data on:

- barriers faced with completing the course
- career trajectories being explored by different womxn in web 3. 
- barriers faced with choosing or following different career trajectories. 

**Who is in our team?**

We are a diverse team from the UK, Germany and Nigeria. We connected over a passion for increasing representation in the space. We bring fresh perspectives from fields of Psychology, Learning and Ecosystem Design, Systems Innovation, Software Development, and Ethical AI. 

You can check us out online:

- Madhuri Rahman -  https://www.linkedin.com/in/madhuri-rahman - @MadhuriRahman

- Blessing Emah - https://www.linkedin.com/in/blessingemah - @TheblessingEmah

- Lena Hierzi - https://www.linkedin.com/in/lena-hierzi-8221151ab - @Gigahierz

project.title: Retroactive Thank you to Volunteers at Token Engineering Barcamp (EthCC Paris 2023)
project.description:
In April 2023, we asked the community for donations to support the first-ever Token Engineering Barcamp event. [With the funds collected in April](https://explorer.gitcoin.co/#/round/1/0x9e669c0a6e075f14ba9d9d98c3580ad67e20ec38/0x9e669c0a6e075f14ba9d9d98c3580ad67e20ec38-19), and additional sponsorships, TE Academy was able to cover all expenses to make the Barcamp happen. Thank you to everyone who supported us!

The first-ever Token Engineering Barcamp took place in Paris on July 22nd. üôÇ
- 17 speakers, and 15 talks,
- more than 8 hours of program,
- 3 stages in parallel
- 500+ registrations so many new connections, collaborations and friendships made! 

To gain an impression of the event, check out the results here:
- [Token Engineering Barcamp Video](https://youtu.be/wIj2la5kQQU)
- Twitter Space with speakers Nate and Vasily as a follow-up [here](https://twitter.com/OfficialESC/status/1686139799806054405?s=20) and [here](https://twitter.com/tokendynamics/status/1688562393067008002?s=20) 
- Womxn in Web3 gave a workshop, running their [next study group iteration](https://twitter.com/GigaHierz/status/1684564050049638401?s=20)
- Roderick hosted a session, published a [recap](https://youtu.be/z9B6ryUbZS0)
- Bonding Curve research group [presented](https://twitter.com/ygg_anderson/status/1686127746563686400?s=20), invites to open research sessions


**The Barcamp was hosted as a public good.**
**It was a free event, accessible for anyone interested in Token Engineering.**
**This current grant is to send a thank you to a total number of 18 volunteers and 4 organizer team contributors who dedicated their time and energy - without asking for any special compensation.**

**Volunteers**:
The French community, led by StephaneSG.eth worked tirelessly since April with the TE Academy team to make the event happen. Eighteen community volunteers helped to prepare the space, supported throughout the day and [captured links and further readings](https://www.notion.so/te-academy/84c64c1b91a545019795cf8556635f2c?v=72df983a743542b29552515b7e1fad3d) for those who have not been able to attend the live event.

**Contributors**:
In addition, TE Academy‚Äôs Kaidlyne, Pati and Nate (TE Commons) were running night shifts to get all information out in time - and Angela pulled all strings to make sure we have awesome speakers and sponsors on board.

**Let‚Äôs reward them with this grant!**
**Funds collected will be distributed to the Barcamp team:**

- 60% to the volunteer leading the organizer team: Stephane
- 30% to the volunteers: 0xAkina, Jules, Sylvain, Wal, Marina, Ajey, Tomas, Mario, Alexandre, Andy, Tatiana, Tiago, Rohan, Jesus, Max, Pascal, and Jimmy
- 10% to the contributors in the organizer team: Angela, Kaidlyne, Nate, Pati

If we collect more $2K in value, we‚Äôll send the rest to a multisig wallet and reserve for future community events.
Send 10% of what you‚Äôd be willing to pay for such an event, make the Barcamp Paris team happy - and encourage volunteers at future Barcamps to bring community events to life!

project.title: Decentralized Library
project.description:
There is no substitute for knowledge. Decentralized library is a no-censorship, LEARN and EARN library that curates books in ebook and video formats. Users who access the library read books or watch video-books and take a short quiz from the book. They earn NFTs when they prove that knowledge is impacted by passing the quiz. The Library will house books and videos in every discipline and make knowledge available for everyone including our children unborn because books are stored permanently on the decentralized web. This project brings the traditional library to web3.



The following benefit awaits users of this project



  1. Lots of Academic E-Books especially in Web3:

  2. Lots of Video-Books:

  3. No Political Censorship:

  4. Learn and Earn: The very First decentralized Library where you LEARN and EARN.

  5. Live Class Streaming:

  6. No Loss of Books: Prevent the accidental or intentional loss of information from human consciousness. Books are stored permanently for humanity.

project.title: SymVal
project.description:
# How can a fungible token be designed to carry high symbolic value? 

When tokens are non-fungible this is an easy task. Many NFTs are designed to hold little or no monetary value, and high symbolic content. 

As an example, [POAPs](https://poap.xyz/about-the-protocol) are minted to symbolize memories of specific moments and events in time and/or space.

Fungible tokens cannot escape holding monetary value, but can they be designed to allow a richer symbolic value as well? 

**Could we create a token still compatible with permissionless automated market makers, but also useful for holding non-monetary values?**

# Can a token carry meaning?

Kernel in their essay brings attention to the [signature economies](https://sign.kernel.community/essay) embedded in blockchains:

*‚ÄúSignatures do not enclose, they bear individual witness to shared events. The messages you sign are at once totally unique‚Äîthere is only one valid signer in the whole world‚Äîand yet they can be broadcast many times over, each time accumulating meaning.‚Äù*

And then asks:

*‚ÄúCan we create a culture where value is propagated by ongoing response, rather than held captive in possessions?‚Äù*

![signature economies](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/700686323950026752/1139497889886908436/signature_economies.png)

# This token engineering research project aims to:

- **explore the possibilities for designing a token able to carry and express symbolic value**
- **develop open source smart contracts available for the community**
- **deploy at least one example instance of a SymVal token as a demonstration of its potential**


# The path so far:

We started with the question: **How to code symbolic values in smart contracts?**

Inspired by ancient "technologies", we are exploring the idea of borrowing concepts and practices from Buddhism, such as prayer wheels, mantras, holy temples / stupas, with the goal of deploying a digital version of them to the blockchain. 

To pursue this idea further, we have started a series of conversations with Marlon Barrios Solano, with the goal of arriving at a token model. 

Marlon is a creative technologist and researcher with a background in software engineering, improvisational dance, and embodied awareness, and also a resident meditation teacher and guest movement instructor for Kernel.

As an early experiment we also asked: 
**Can a token display more than just a balance in a wallet?**

Together with Simon Wairiuko from the Regro Project we proposed an idea for a token on the NEAR blockchain, taking advantage of the fact their token standard includes an on-chain token icon image supported by the NEAR wallet.

Simon is an artist, farmer and developer, and he created an interactive SVG that shows day/night cycles, a tree's respiration cycle, and localized seasons like Winter and Summer, based on the device‚Äôs location and time zone. 

This early experiment dealt only with the token UI display and not yet with the underlying contracts and logic, but was already a step towards the main research question.

The SVG can be visualized at: https://teia.art/objkt/651699

![Regro interactive SVG](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/921764666567450664/937351385555542026/IMG_5352.jpg)

# Where we are:

We are currently in the token design phase. As we progress we will post updates on our website:

https://symval.gitbook.io/


# Team:

Lenara Verle - https://twitter.com/lenara
Marlon Barrios Solano - https://twitter.com/MarlonBarriosS2
Simon Wairiuko - https://twitter.com/simon_wairiuko

project.title: AURA Dashboard
project.description:
The issue of user coordination lies at the heart of blockchain protocol design and financial incentives are one of the means to achieve it. These incentives are threaded in the architecture of the protocol and should enable extensive decentralization among network operators. Several projects have tried to achieve decentralization by employing different models based on financial incentives, each model tailored to the objective function of the protocol. Proof of Work (PoW) and the various iterations of Proof of Stake (PoS) exemplify the incentive models used to align network participants and reach consensus.

Presently, numerous Layer 2 (L2) smart contract platforms built on the Ethereum network compete for market share and aim at network decentralization. In an effort to achieve decentralization within the network and to attract users from the broader ecosystem, these L2 platforms have incentivized usage of their networks through the distribution of their native tokens via 'airdrops'.

Our goal is to build an online dashboard, named Airdrop User Retention Analysis (AURA), that can be accessed for free and could potentially inform incentive design choices for protocols that would consider employing airdrops in the future. Key to the realization of the dashboard is the definition of a metric that evaluates user retention over time on a dollar cost basis. Through the establishment and generalization of this metric, we aspire to devise a framework that facilitates comparisons between the effectiveness of the incentivization strategies employed by different L2 Networks.

answers.question: What specific problem(s) do you seek to solve with this grant, and how will you know whether you have accomplished your goal(s)?
answers.answer:
AURA aims to solve the problem of user coordination that lies at the heart of protocol design. We know that financial incentives are one means to achieve it; thus, projects have tried to achieve that coordination by employing different models based on financial incentives, with each model tailored to the objective function of the protocol. Airdrops are one of the most utilized means to attract new users; however, they often fall short in retaining these users after the airdrop event occurs. This effectively undermines the effectiveness of airdrops, as value rapidly flows out of the protocol, resulting in a hidden cost for the protocol.

Our goal is to develop a robust and relevant metric that can assess the average cost for user retention within L2 networks. To achieve this, we will gather data concerning network usage and juxtapose it with the distribution dynamics of each network's native token. Specifically, we aim to analyze how network usage and user behavior fluctuated across different phases of the airdrop distribution.

The main way for us to determine whether we have accomplished our goal of providing value as a public good will be through monitoring the activity on our website. Once we publish the final version of the dashboard, we will evaluate the effectiveness of our study based on the traffic it receives. We will also offer support to users who would like to delve deeper into the analysis of each protocol's airdrop event, with the hope of informing future airdrop design decisions.

answers.question: Describe how your project contributes to token engineering and why is it a valuable public good.
answers.answer:
AURA contributes to the token engineering discipline by aiming to demonstrate that "airdrops are not created equal." This means that there can be more and less effective ways of designing airdrop events. Since airdrops are closely tied to the tokenomics of a protocol and its token design, we believe that our study will help shed light on the sustainable design of protocol airdrops and potentially inform future design decisions, resulting in improved effectiveness.

We will initially focus on L2 protocols, as many projects have launched airdrops in this space, and attempting to capture all of this data would distract us from our main objectives. Once we have covered the L2 protocol space, the next milestone in our roadmap will be to expand to the broader DeFi space.

AURA is considered a public good because it is freely accessible and built openly. This means we will share the analysis behind the creation of the dashboard, allowing projects working on airdrops to find AURA as a valuable resource for consultation. We are committed to keeping the project free and open, which is why we have applied to GR18 to secure a budget that can support our engineering and research efforts in developing AURA.
